intro: Mostacillastrum gracielae, commonly known as the Gracielas' grass, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with delicate, pale green to blue-gray florets. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments through deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area. Mostacillastrum gracielae plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife.
